Tutorials.Item: Bodylogical AR requires some physical space for the stage where the stories take place. Move your device around some flat surface to let the camera scan for empty space. The scanned space will be highlighted in yellow.

Bodylogical AR requires some physical space for the stage where the stories take place. Move your device around some flat surface to let the camera scan for empty space. The scanned space will be highlighted in yellow. When you have found an ideal surface, double tap the screen to place your stage.
Move your device to adjust the position of the stage. Double tap to confirm the stage position.
Touch an avatar on the screen to examine his/her stats. In general, to interact with different AR components, such as buttons, simply touch/click them on the screen.

The panel has three sections. The control panel allows you to switch between different visualizations, go forward in time, and to change different "interventions" for the avatar. The settings panel allows you to switch display language, or to choose another avatar. The ribbon panel is only for the Ribbon Chart visualization, and allows various tweaks to the graph. Now you can inspect the lifestyle of the avatar. When you are ready, click "Next" to continue to the first visualization, the Activity view.

Use the left half of the control panel to switch between internventions. Click "Animate" to start the timing progress. You can also drag the handle of the progress bar to jump to a specific year. Click "Reset" to go back to the current year. When you are done exploring, click "Next" to go to the Prius visualization.
Check the panel on the right to inspect the details of the organs. Move your device closer to the avatar to see how Bodylogical works internally.

Each panel represents the avatar's health status in 5 year intervals. The metrics are connected with ribbons to highlight changes in numbers. Click on one specific biometric to study it closely. For more options, please click on the "Ribbons" panel.

Use the left part to switch between different interventions. On the right part there are four tweaking options: "Show Ribbons" will toggle the ribbons on and off and would allow you to better inspect the numbers themselves. "Transparent" will make the background transparent. "Dim" will make the status bars dimmer so you can focus more on the ribbons. "Hide bars" will hide the status bars, and gets rid of any distractions for the ribbons.
